data.text:
Found 1810 Results

Page 1 of 181

Handbook to the Iron Age. – Huffman, Thomas N

The Archaeology of Pre-Colonial Farming Societies in Southern Africa Detailed handbook providing an overview of the archaeology of the farming communities covering the last 2000 years in southern Africa. Abundantly illustrated. Small area of scuffing to half title page. Pencil inscription to title page. 504 Pages. This is a heavy item and will incur additional…

12th August 2024

Irma Stern: The Early Years, 1894 – 1933 – Schoeman, Karel

Biography based mainly on unpublished material in the Irma Stern Collection at the South African Library. Published as a contribution to the commemoration of the artist’s birth a century ago. 127 Pages. Contents clean and binding firm. 1st Edition. Condition: Very good. Binding: Softcover. Some mild edge-wear. Publisher: South African Library Date Published: 1994 Publication…

Ganzekraal. A West Coast Year – Kuttel, Mary Melck

Written from a manuscript which was found amongst her mother’s papers after her death, the author describes an idyllic Edwardian childhood spent on a country farm on the West Coast. This book is a tribute to the memory of the lovely farm and happy years spent there. Charming illustrations. 1st Edition. Condition: Very good. Binding:…

Ghaap and Gariep. Later Stone Age Studies in the Northern Cape – Humphreys, A.J.B. & Thackeray, Anne I.

Focussing on the Stone Age archaeology of the Holocene, the last 10 000 years of geological time in the Northern Cape. Some b&w photograps, illustrations and graphs. 328 Pages. Contents clean and binding firm. Condition: Very good. Binding: Softcover. Cardwraps. Some mild edge-wear. Publisher: The South African Archaeological Society Monograph Series. No. 2 Date Published:…

African Naissance: The Limpopo Valley 1000 Years Ago. – Mary Leslie and Tim Maggs (edits)

The South African Archaeological Society Goodwin Series Vol 8, December 2000. Contents clean and binding firm. 126 Pages. 1st Edition. Condition: Good. Binding: Softcover. 3 tiny abrasions to spine. Publisher: The South African Archaeological Society. Date Published: 2000 First Edition: Yes Condition: Good. Binding: Softcover. 3 tiny abrasions to spine.

Bottles & Bygones. A Guide for South African Collectors – Lastovica, Ethleen (text)

Richly illustrated with colour photographs. Includes sections on china dolls and pipes, porcelain pot lids, et al. “Cancelled” stamp on title page. Creasing to the lower corner on page 43. 104 Pages. Contents clean and binding sound. 2nd Edition. Condition: Good. Dust jacket: Good. 3cm closed tear to rear cover. Some mild edge-wear. Small square…

Karoo Rock Engravings. Marking places in the landscape (inscribed) – Parkington, John, Morris, David and Rusch, Neil

Fourth book in a series of publications about the archaeology of southern Africa. Inscribed by the author on the title page. 127 Pages. Contents clean. Binding sound. 1st Edition. Condition: Very good. Binding: Softcover. Mild edge-wear. Publisher: Creda Publications Date Published: 2008 Publication Place: Cape Town First Edition: Yes Signed: Yes Condition: Very good. Binding:…

Gladiolus. Journal of South African Botany Supplementary Volume No. 10. – Lewis, G Joyce & Obermeyer, A Amelia

A revision of the South African Species. Contains description of 103 species, including many new to science. Lavishly illustrated with 32 full colour plates as well as 51 half–tone plates and 30 black and white figures. Includes notes on hybrids and the story of the evolution of the best-known hybrids now used extensively by horticulturists…

Ericas in Southern Africa – Baker, H A & Oliver, E G H (Text)

This volume is a representative of a cross-section of the genus as a whole throughout Southern Africa with 167 species illustrated in full colour and great detail. Previous owner’s name has been tippexed on the title page. Includes an index and list of colour plates. 180 Pages. Contents clean and binding tight. 1st Edition. Condition:…

Amaryllidaceae of Southern Africa – Duncan, Graham (Text)

The first comprehensive, illustrated account devoted to one of the most charismatic plant families, the Amaryllidaceae. Each genus is introduced withg splendid colour photographs. 709 Pages. Contents clean and binding sound. This is a heavy book weight over 3kgs. 1st Edition. Condition: Near fine. Dust jcket: Near fine. Binding: Hardcover. Grey cloth boards with gilt…

7th August 2024
